solution: First, note that $x^4 - 16x^2 + 64$ can be rewritten as a quadratic in terms of $y = x^2$, that is, $y^2 - 16y + 64$. This factors as $(y-8)^2$. Substituting back $y = x^2$, we have $(x^2-8)^2$. This can be further factored using difference of squares to $(x-2\sqrt{2})(x+2\sqrt{2})(x-2\sqrt{2})(x+2\sqrt{2}) = \boxed{(x-2\sqrt{2})^2(x+2\sqrt{2})^2}$.
